SEARCH

Class FileSystem

java.lang.Object
FileSystem
public class FileSystem extends Object
Constructs a new FileSystem object with a root directory named "root". The root directory has no parent directory as it represents the top-level directory in the file system.

  • Method Details

    • createDirectory

      public void createDirectory(String name, Directory parent)
      Creates a new directory with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the directory to be created.

    • createFile

      public void createFile(String name, Directory parent)
      Creates a new file with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the file to be created.

    • deleteFile

      public void deleteFile(String name, Directory parent)
      Deletes the file with the specified name from the specified parent directory.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the file to be deleted.
      parent - The parent directory from which the file should be deleted.

    • deleteDirectory

      public void deleteDirectory(String name, Directory parent)
      Recursively deletes the directory with the specified name from the specified parent directory, along with all its contents (files and subdirectories). If the directory does not exist within the parent directory or if it's not a directory, the method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the directory to be recursively deleted.
      parent - The parent directory from which the directory will be recursively deleted.

    • moveElement

      public void moveElement(String name, Directory parent, Directory newParent)
      Moves the file or directory with the specified name from the current parent directory to a new parent directory. If the element does not exist in the current parent directory or if any of the directories (current or new parent) is null, the method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the file or directory to be moved.
      parent - The current parent directory from which the element will be moved.
      newParent - The new parent directory to which the element will be moved.

    • search

      public String search(String name)
      Searches for a file or directory with the specified name starting from the root directory. Returns the path to the element found if it exists, otherwise returns null.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the file or directory to search for.
      Returns:
      The path to the element found, or null if not found.

    • printDirectoryTree

      public void printDirectoryTree(Directory dir)
      Prints the path to the current directory from the root directory, followed by the directory tree.
      Parameters:
      dir - The current directory.

    • listContents

      public void listContents(Directory dir)
      Lists the contents (files and subdirectories) of the given directory.
      Parameters:
      dir - The directory whose contents are to be listed.

    • sortDirectoryByDate

      public void sortDirectoryByDate(Directory dir)
      Sorts the contents of the given directory by date created and prints the sorted list.
      Parameters:
      dir - The directory whose contents are to be sorted.

    • changeDirectory

      public Directory changeDirectory(Directory currentDirectory, Directory newDirectory)
      Changes the current directory to the specified directory. (This part is mainly executed in main code)
      Parameters:
      currentDirectory - The current directory.
      newDirectory - The new directory to change to.
      Returns:
      The new directory if found, otherwise returns the current directory.

    • getCurrentPath

      public String getCurrentPath(Directory dir)
      Gets the current path of the given directory.
      Parameters:
      dir - The directory to get the current path for.
      Returns:
      The current path of the directory.

    • getRoot

      public Directory getRoot()
      Gets the root directory of the file system.
      Returns:
      The root directory.

    • getDepth

      public int getDepth(Directory dir)
      Calculates the depth of the given directory in the directory tree.
      Parameters:
      dir - The directory to calculate the depth for.
      Returns:
      The depth of the directory.
